New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in major league history to reach 50 homers and 50 steals in a season
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit his 50th home run in the seventh inning with an opposite-field shot
Ohtani stole his 50th base in the first inning
Ohtani hit his 49th homer in the sixth inning
Pre-Game Insights: There has been talk that Ohtani shouldn’t win it because a designated hitter never has won it
Critics have charged that a player who is required only to use half of the skills required of an everyday player simply cannot be considered most valuable
Post-Match Reflections: Miguel Rojas had the same feeling with the opposite reaction
‘I almost cried, to be honest with you, because it was a lot of emotions, because of everything that happens behind the scenes that we got to witness every single day’
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers beat Miami 20-4 to clinch a playoff berth
Ohtani went six for six on those swings
The game was a win that clinched the Dodgers’ 12th consecutive playoff berth
